title: Authors and Citation
text: Barja , Ferreyra Y (2025). land4health: Remote Sensing Metrics Spatial Health Analysis. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://harmonize-tools.github.io/land4health/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {land4health: Remote Sensing Metrics for Spatial Health Analysis},   author = {Antony Barja and Yomali Ferreyra},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://harmonize-tools.github.io/land4health/}, }

title: land4health
text: Calculate extract remote sensing metrics spatial health analysis 🛰️. package offers R users quick easy way obtain areal zonal statistics key indicators covariates, ideal modeling infectious diseases 🦠 within framework spatial epidemiology 🏥.

title: land4health
text: can install development version land4health GitHub :
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("harmonize-tools/land4health") library(land4health) ee_Initialize(quiet = TRUE) ── Welcome to land4health ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── A tool of Harmonize Project to calculate and extract Remote Sensing Metrics for Spatial Health Analysis. Currently,`land4health` supports metrics related to the following categories: • Enviroment • Human intervention • and more! For more information about metrics, please use the `get_metrics_metadata()` function.  ── Attaching core land4health packages ───────────────────────────────────────────────────── → rgee v1.1.7 → sf v1.0.20

title: land4health
code: l4h_list_metrics() #> # A tibble: 7 × 11 #>   category           metric   pixel_resolution_met…¹ dataset start_year end_year #>   <chr>              <chr>                     <int> <chr>        <int>    <int> #> 1 Human intervention Defores…                     30 Hansen…       2000     2023 #> 2 Human intervention Human M…                    300 Global…       1990     2017 #> 3 Human intervention Populat…                    100 WorldP…       2000     2021 #> 4 Human intervention Urban a…                    500 MODIS …       2001     2022 #> 5 Human intervention Night t…                    500 VIIRS …       1992     2023 #> 6 Human intervention Human S…                     30 Global…       1975     2030 #> 7 Enviroment         Urban H…                   1000 Urban …       2003     2020 #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​pixel_resolution_meters #> # ℹ 5 more variables: resolution_temporal <chr>, layer_can_be_actived <lgl>, #> #   tags <chr>, lifecycle <chr>, url <chr>

what: 3. Example: Calculate Forest Loss in a Custom Region
title: land4health
text: example demonstrates calculate forest loss 2005 2020 using custom polygon Earth Engine.
code: library(geoidep) # Downloading the adminstration limits of Loreto provinces provinces_loreto <- get_provinces(show_progress = FALSE) |>   subset(nombdep == "LORETO")  # Run forest loss calculation result <- provinces_loreto |>   l4h_forest_loss(from = 2005, to = 2020, sf = TRUE) head(result) #> Simple feature collection with 6 features and 11 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -76.89454 ymin: -6.14773 xmax: -75.38564 ymax: -3.681529 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> # A tibble: 6 × 12 #>      id objectid ccdd  ccpp  nombdep nombprov shape_length shape_area date       #>   <int>    <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr>   <chr>           <dbl>      <dbl> <date>     #> 1   136      136 16    02    LORETO  ALTO AM…         9.96       1.57 2005-01-01 #> 2   136      136 16    02    LORETO  ALTO AM…         9.96       1.57 2006-01-01 #> 3   136      136 16    02    LORETO  ALTO AM…         9.96       1.57 2007-01-01 #> 4   136      136 16    02    LORETO  ALTO AM…         9.96       1.57 2008-01-01 #> 5   136      136 16    02    LORETO  ALTO AM…         9.96       1.57 2009-01-01 #> 6   136      136 16    02    LORETO  ALTO AM…         9.96       1.57 2010-01-01 #> # ℹ 3 more variables: variable <chr>, value <dbl>, geometry <MULTIPOLYGON [°]> # Visualization with ggplot2 library(ggplot2) ggplot(data = st_drop_geometry(result), aes(x = date, y = value)) +   geom_area(fill = "#DC8665", alpha = 0.8) +   facet_wrap(~nombprov) +   theme_minimal() # Spatial visualization ggplot(data = result) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = value), color = NA) +   scale_fill_gradientn(name = "Forest loss mean \n(km²)",colours = c("#DC8665","#138086","#534666","#CD7672","#eeb462")) +   theme_minimal(base_size = 15) +   facet_wrap(date ~ .)

what: 4. Example: Extract time series of climate variables
title: land4health
code: etp_ts <- provinces_loreto |>   l4h_sebal_modis(     from = "2005-01-01",     to = "2022-12-31",     by = "month"   ) etp_ts |>   st_drop_geometry() |>   ggplot(aes(x = date, y = value, col = value)) +   geom_line() +   scale_color_viridis_c("ETP (mm)",option = "mako") +   theme_minimal() +   facet_wrap(~nombprov, ncol = 4)

what: Extracts forest cover loss within a defined polygon — l4h_forest_loss
title: Extracts forest cover loss within a defined polygon — l4h_forest_loss
text: Calculates forest loss within user-defined region specified year range. Forest loss defined stand-replacement disturbance, change forest non-forest state.

title: Extracts forest cover loss within a defined polygon — l4h_forest_loss
code: l4h_forest_loss(from, to, region, sf = TRUE, quiet = FALSE, force = FALSE, ...)

title: Extracts forest cover loss within a defined polygon — l4h_forest_loss
text: Integer. start year analysis window, ranging 2001 one year current year (e.g., today 2025, maximum 2024). Integer. end year analysis window, ranging current year. Must >= (e.g., = 2010, valid values 2010–2025 current year 2025). region spatial object defining region interest. Accepts sf, sfc, SpatVector object (terra package). sf Logical. Return result sf object? Default TRUE. quiet Logical. TRUE, suppress progress bar (default FALSE). force Logical. Force request extract. ... arguments ee_extract rgee packages.

title: Extracts forest cover loss within a defined polygon — l4h_forest_loss
text: sf tibble object forest loss per year square kilometers.

title: Extracts forest cover loss within a defined polygon — l4h_forest_loss
text: Forest loss derived Hansen Global Forest Change dataset. lossyear band encodes year forest cover loss follows: Values range 1 n, 1 corresponds year 2001 n year 2000 + n. value 0 indicates forest loss detected.

title: Extracts forest cover loss within a defined polygon — l4h_forest_loss
text: Hansen, M. C., Potapov, P. V., Moore, R., Hancher, M., Turubanova, S. ., Tyukavina, ., ... & Townshend, J. R. G. (2013). High-Resolution Global Maps 21st-Century Forest Cover Change. Science, 342(6160), 850–853. DOI: doi:10.1126/science.1244693

title: Extracts forest cover loss within a defined polygon — l4h_forest_loss
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(land4health) ee_Initialize()  # Define region as a bounding box polygon region <- st_as_sf(st_sfc(   st_polygon(list(matrix(c(     -74.1, -4.4,     -74.1, -3.7,     -73.2, -3.7,     -73.2, -4.4,     -74.1, -4.4   ), ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE))),   crs = 4326 ))  # Run forest loss calculation result <- l4h_forest_loss(from = 2005, to = 2007, region = region) head(result) } # }

what: List available metrics in land4health — l4h_list_metrics
title: List available metrics in land4health — l4h_list_metrics
text: Returns tibble metadata every metric shipped land4health.  can optionally filter thematic category, metric short name, provider. open_in_browser = TRUE, matching URLs opened default browser; safety must supply least one filter, —five tabs open—asked confirm interactive sessions.

title: List available metrics in land4health — l4h_list_metrics
code: l4h_list_metrics(   category = NULL,   metric = NULL,   provider = NULL,   open_in_browser = FALSE )

title: List available metrics in land4health — l4h_list_metrics
text: category Optional single string. Filter thematic category. metric Optional single string. Filter metric short name. provider Optional single string. Filter dataset column. open_in_browser Logical; open matching URLs browser? Defaults FALSE.

title: List available metrics in land4health — l4h_list_metrics
text: tibble (returned invisibly).  open_in_browser = FALSE compact preview (max 10 rows) printed tibble returned.

title: List available metrics in land4health — l4h_list_metrics
code: ## All examples keep `open_in_browser = FALSE` to avoid side-effects ## during automated checks.  ## 1  Show the full inventory (truncated to 10 rows). l4h_list_metrics() #> # A tibble: 7 × 11 #>   category           metric   pixel_resolution_met…¹ dataset start_year end_year #>   <chr>              <chr>                     <int> <chr>        <int>    <int> #> 1 Human intervention Defores…                     30 Hansen…       2000     2023 #> 2 Human intervention Human M…                    300 Global…       1990     2017 #> 3 Human intervention Populat…                    100 WorldP…       2000     2021 #> 4 Human intervention Urban a…                    500 MODIS …       2001     2022 #> 5 Human intervention Night t…                    500 VIIRS …       1992     2023 #> 6 Human intervention Human S…                     30 Global…       1975     2030 #> 7 Enviroment         Urban H…                   1000 Urban …       2003     2020 #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​pixel_resolution_meters #> # ℹ 5 more variables: resolution_temporal <chr>, layer_can_be_actived <lgl>, #> #   tags <chr>, lifecycle <chr>, url <chr>  ## 2  Filter by category (“Human intervention”). l4h_list_metrics(category = "Human intervention") #> # A tibble: 6 × 11 #>   category           metric   pixel_resolution_met…¹ dataset start_year end_year #>   <chr>              <chr>                     <int> <chr>        <int>    <int> #> 1 Human intervention Defores…                     30 Hansen…       2000     2023 #> 2 Human intervention Human M…                    300 Global…       1990     2017 #> 3 Human intervention Populat…                    100 WorldP…       2000     2021 #> 4 Human intervention Urban a…                    500 MODIS …       2001     2022 #> 5 Human intervention Night t…                    500 VIIRS …       1992     2023 #> 6 Human intervention Human S…                     30 Global…       1975     2030 #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​pixel_resolution_meters #> # ℹ 5 more variables: resolution_temporal <chr>, layer_can_be_actived <lgl>, #> #   tags <chr>, lifecycle <chr>, url <chr>  ## 3  Filter by provider (“WorldPop”) and store the result. worldpop_tbl <- l4h_list_metrics(provider = "WorldPop") #> # A tibble: 1 × 11 #>   category           metric   pixel_resolution_met…¹ dataset start_year end_year #>   <chr>              <chr>                     <int> <chr>        <int>    <int> #> 1 Human intervention Populat…                    100 WorldP…       2000     2021 #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​pixel_resolution_meters #> # ℹ 5 more variables: resolution_temporal <chr>, layer_can_be_actived <lgl>, #> #   tags <chr>, lifecycle <chr>, url <chr> head(worldpop_tbl) #> # A tibble: 1 × 11 #>   category           metric   pixel_resolution_met…¹ dataset start_year end_year #>   <chr>              <chr>                     <int> <chr>        <int>    <int> #> 1 Human intervention Populat…                    100 WorldP…       2000     2021 #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​pixel_resolution_meters #> # ℹ 5 more variables: resolution_temporal <chr>, layer_can_be_actived <lgl>, #> #   tags <chr>, lifecycle <chr>, url <chr>  ## 4  Pipe into dplyr (executes in < 1 s, loaded only if available). if (requireNamespace("dplyr", quietly = TRUE)) {   l4h_list_metrics() |>     dplyr::filter(pixel_resolution_meters <= 100) |>     dplyr::select(metric, start_year, end_year) } #> # A tibble: 7 × 11 #>   category           metric   pixel_resolution_met…¹ dataset start_year end_year #>   <chr>              <chr>                     <int> <chr>        <int>    <int> #> 1 Human intervention Defores…                     30 Hansen…       2000     2023 #> 2 Human intervention Human M…                    300 Global…       1990     2017 #> 3 Human intervention Populat…                    100 WorldP…       2000     2021 #> 4 Human intervention Urban a…                    500 MODIS …       2001     2022 #> 5 Human intervention Night t…                    500 VIIRS …       1992     2023 #> 6 Human intervention Human S…                     30 Global…       1975     2030 #> 7 Enviroment         Urban H…                   1000 Urban …       2003     2020 #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​pixel_resolution_meters #> # ℹ 5 more variables: resolution_temporal <chr>, layer_can_be_actived <lgl>, #> #   tags <chr>, lifecycle <chr>, url <chr> #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>   metric                 start_year end_year #>   <chr>                       <int>    <int> #> 1 Deforestation                2000     2023 #> 2 Population                   2000     2021 #> 3 Human Settlement Layer       1975     2030  ## 5  Trying to open links without filters triggers an error; ##    wrapped in \dontrun{} so R CMD check is not interrupted. if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ l4h_list_metrics(open_in_browser = TRUE) } # }

title: List all land4health packages — l4h_packages
text: List land4health packages

text: include_self default TRUE. Includes "land4health" package name resultant character vector.

text: character vector package names included "land4health" meta-package.

code: l4h_packages() #> [1] "rgee"        "sf"          "land4health"

title: Compute Rural Access Index (RAI) — l4h_rural_access_index
text: Calculates Rural Access Index (RAI) given region using datasets GEE Community Catalog. RAI represents proportion rural population living within 2 km -season road, aligning SDG indicator 9.1.1.

title: Compute Rural Access Index (RAI) — l4h_rural_access_index
code: l4h_rural_access_index(   region,   weighted = FALSE,   fun = NULL,   sf = FALSE,   quiet = FALSE,   force = FALSE,   ... )

title: Compute Rural Access Index (RAI) — l4h_rural_access_index
text: region spatial object defining region interest. Can sf, sfc object, SpatVector (terra package). weighted Logical. TRUE, computes population-weighted RAI (.e., rural population access divided total rural population). FALSE, computes area-based RAI (.e., total pixel area access divided total rural area). Default FALSE. fun Character. Summary function apply population raster weighted = TRUE. Common values include "mean", "sum", etc. Ignored weighted = FALSE. Default "mean". sf Logical. TRUE, returns result sf object. FALSE, returns Earth Engine object. Default FALSE. quiet Logical. TRUE, suppress progress bar (default FALSE). force Logical. TRUE, skips representativity check forces extraction. Default FALSE. ... arguments ee_extract rgee packages.

title: Compute Rural Access Index (RAI) — l4h_rural_access_index
text: spatial object containing computed RAI value region sf tibble object.

title: Compute Rural Access Index (RAI) — l4h_rural_access_index
text: function uses following datasets GEE Community Catalog: projects/sat-io/open-datasets/RAI/ruralpopaccess – raster rural population access -season roads projects/sat-io/open-datasets/RAI/inaccessibilityindex – binary raster indicating access areas (1 = access, 0 = access) weighted = TRUE, RAI calculated sum (chosen summary via fun) accessible rural population divided total rural population within specified region. weighted = FALSE, RAI calculated ratio pixel areas: total area (km²) access divided total rural area. fun parameter applies weighted = TRUE. ignored otherwise.

title: Compute Rural Access Index (RAI) — l4h_rural_access_index
text: GEE Community Catalog: https://gee-community-catalog.org/projects/rai Frontiers Remote Sensing (2024): doi:10.3389/frsen.2024.1375476

title: Compute Rural Access Index (RAI) — l4h_rural_access_index
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(land4health) ee_Initialize() # Population-weighted RAI l4h_rural_access_index(region, weighted = TRUE, fun = "sum", sf = TRUE)  # Area-based RAI l4h_rural_access_index(region, weighted = FALSE, sf = TRUE) } # }

what: Download and process evapotranspiration data — l4h_sebal_modis
title: Download and process evapotranspiration data — l4h_sebal_modis
text: function accesses geeSEBAL-MODIS collection published ET-Brasil project, extracts etp band (daily evapotranspiration mm/day), allows temporal aggregation 8-day images monthly yearly composites period. Optionally, results can returned sf/tibble objects R.

title: Download and process evapotranspiration data — l4h_sebal_modis
code: l4h_sebal_modis(   from,   to,   by = "8 days",   region,   fun = "mean",   sf = TRUE,   force = FALSE,   quiet = FALSE,   ... )

title: Download and process evapotranspiration data — l4h_sebal_modis
text: Start date "YYYY-MM-DD" format. End date "YYYY-MM-DD" format. Temporal aggregation frequency. Options: "8 days" (original 8-day composites), "month" (monthly average sum), "annual" (annual avergae sumperiod). region spatial object defining region interest. Accepts sf, SpatVector, ee$FeatureCollection objects. fun Aggregation function = "month" "total". Valid values "mean" "sum". sf Logical. Return result sf object? Default TRUE. force Logical. TRUE, forces download even local file already exists. quiet Logical. TRUE, suppress progress bar (default FALSE). ... arguments ee_extract rgee packages.

title: Download and process evapotranspiration data — l4h_sebal_modis
text: sf tibble object etp values.

title: Download and process evapotranspiration data — l4h_sebal_modis
text: Comini, B., Ruhoff, ., Laipelt, L., Fleischmann, ., Huntington, J., Morton, C., Melton, F., Erickson, T., Roberti, D., Souza, V., Biudes, M., Machado, N., Santos, C. & Cosio, E. (2023). geeSEBAL‑MODIS: Continental‑scale evapotranspiration based surface energy balance South America. Preprint. DOI: 10.13140/RG.2.2.17579.11041 geeSEBAL‑MODIS v0‑02 dataset. Licensed Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC‑‑4.0) license.

title: Download and process evapotranspiration data — l4h_sebal_modis
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## Assume `my_roi` is an sf polygon covering your area of interest. ## 1. Eight-day composites (8 days) ##    2020-01-01 → 2020-12-31, reducer = "mean" sebal_8d <- l4h_sebal_modis(   from   = "2020-01-01",   to     = "2020-12-31",   region = my_roi )  ## 2. Monthly means ##    Same period, but aggregated to calendar months sebal_month <- l4h_sebal_modis(   from   = "2020-01-01",   to     = "2020-12-31",   by     = "month",   region = my_roi )  ## 3. Annual evapotranspiration ##    2015 → 2023, one value per year sebal_annual <- l4h_sebal_modis(   from   = 2015,   to     = 2023,   by     = "annual",   fun    = "sum",   region = my_roi,   sf     = FALSE ) } # }

what: Travel Time to Healthcare or Cities (Oxford Dataset) — l4h_travel_time
title: Travel Time to Healthcare or Cities (Oxford Dataset) — l4h_travel_time
text: Retrieves travel time raster (minutes) nearest healthcare facility populated city, based Oxford Global Map Accessibility datasets.

title: Travel Time to Healthcare or Cities (Oxford Dataset) — l4h_travel_time
code: l4h_travel_time(   region,   destination = "cities",   transport_mode = "all",   fun = "mean",   sf = FALSE,   quiet = FALSE,   force = FALSE,   ... )

title: Travel Time to Healthcare or Cities (Oxford Dataset) — l4h_travel_time
text: region spatial object defining region interest. Can sf, sfc object, SpatVector (terra package). destination Character. Target destination travel time. Use "healthcare" (default) travel time nearest healthcare facility, "cities" travel time nearest populated urban center. transport_mode Character. Mode transportation. Use "" (default) general travel time (mixed modes), "walking_only" walking-accessibility (valid destination = "healthcare"). fun Character. Summary function apply. Values include "mean", "sum","median" , etc. Default "mean". sf Logical. TRUE, returns result sf object. FALSE, returns Earth Engine object. Default FALSE. quiet Logical. TRUE, suppress progress bar (default FALSE). force Logical. TRUE, skips internal representativity check input region. Defaults FALSE. ... arguments ee_extract rgee packages.

title: Travel Time to Healthcare or Cities (Oxford Dataset) — l4h_travel_time
text: spatial object containing computed RAI value region sf tibble object.

title: Travel Time to Healthcare or Cities (Oxford Dataset) — l4h_travel_time
text: Weiss, D.J. et al. (2018). global map travel time cities assess inequalities accessibility 2015. Nature, 553(7688), 333–336. DOI: 10.1038/nature25181 Weiss, D.J. et al. (2020). Global maps travel time healthcare facilities. Nature Medicine, 26, 1835–1838. DOI: 10.1038/s41591-020-1059-1

title: Travel Time to Healthcare or Cities (Oxford Dataset) — l4h_travel_time
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Travel time to nearest hospital (all transport modes) l4h_travel_time(my_shape)  # Travel time to hospital (walking only) l4h_travel_time(my_shape, transport_mode = "walking_only")  # Travel time to cities l4h_travel_time(my_shape, destination = "cities")  # Mean travel time to cities l4h_travel_time(my_shape, destination = "cities", reducer = ee$Reducer$mean()) } # }

what: Annual Proportion of Water Coverage from MapBiomas Perú — l4h_water_proportion
title: Annual Proportion of Water Coverage from MapBiomas Perú — l4h_water_proportion
text: function returns proportion region's area covered surface water year. values expressed decimal ratio 0 1 (e.g., 0.25 means 25% area covered water).

title: Annual Proportion of Water Coverage from MapBiomas Perú — l4h_water_proportion
code: l4h_water_proportion(   from,   to,   region,   fun = "mean",   sf = TRUE,   quiet = FALSE,   force = FALSE,   ... )

title: Annual Proportion of Water Coverage from MapBiomas Perú — l4h_water_proportion
text: Integer. Start year (e.g., 1985). Integer. End year (e.g., 2022). Must equal greater . region spatial object defining region interest. Can sf, sfc object, SpatVector (terra package). fun Character. Summary function apply. Values include "mean", "sum","median" , etc. Default "mean". sf Logical. Return result sf object? Default TRUE. quiet Logical. TRUE, suppress progress bar (default FALSE). FALSE, returns Earth Engine ImageCollection. force Logical. TRUE, skips internal representativity checks input geometry. Defaults FALSE. ... arguments ee_extract rgee packages.

title: Annual Proportion of Water Coverage from MapBiomas Perú — l4h_water_proportion
text: object containing annual water coverage. Depending sf, may sf object, list, Earth Engine ImageCollection yearly layers.

title: Annual Proportion of Water Coverage from MapBiomas Perú — l4h_water_proportion
text: MapBiomas Perú (2021). Colección 1 – Annual water coverage. Mapbiomas project, available : https://peru.mapbiomas.org/colecciones-de-mapbiomas-peru/

title: Annual Proportion of Water Coverage from MapBiomas Perú — l4h_water_proportion
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Extract water coverage between 2000 and 2020 l4h_water_proportion(from = 2000, to = 2020, region = my_basin) } # }

what: land4health: Remote Sensing Metrics for Spatial Health Analysis — land4health-package
title: land4health: Remote Sensing Metrics for Spatial Health Analysis — land4health-package
text: Calculate extract remote sensing metrics spatial analysis field health. package offers R users quick straightforward way obtain areal zonal statistics key environmental indicators, covariates, vector-borne disease data ideal modeling infectious diseases within framework spatial epidemiology.

title: land4health: Remote Sensing Metrics for Spatial Health Analysis — land4health-package
text: Maintainer: Yomali Ferreyra yomali.ferreyra@upch.pe (ORCID) Authors: Antony Barja antony.barja@upch.pe (ORCID) contributors: Diego Villa [contributor]

what: Split an sf object into a list of single-row sf objects — split_sf
